      • addTimeSpan

        public void addTimeSpan(boolean failed,
               org.joda.time.DateTime startTime,
               org.joda.time.DateTime endTime)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        IllegalDateException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This will create a new timespan for the task
        Parameters:
        startTime - The start time of the timespan
        endTime - The end time of the timespan
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The startTime cannot be equal to null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The endTime is equal to null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Exception will be thrown if the end time is earlier than the start time
        IllegalDateException

      • checkResourceTypeSelfConflicting

        private boolean checkResourceTypeSelfConflicting(ResourceType resourceType,
                                       int amount)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the resource type is self conflicting or not
        Parameters:
        resourceType - The resource type to be checked
        amount - The amount of resources needed of this type
        Returns:
        Returns true if the amount is larger than 1 and if the resource type is self conflicting
